forecast.name: Independence Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West wind 21 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 35 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 52. West southwest wind 13 to 23 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

weather_report:
Downtown San Francisco greets the day with a clear and inviting sky, the light of the sun pouring over the iconic landscape in the gentle embrace of a westerly breeze. As you stand amongst the bustling streets, a sense of vibrancy fills the air. With a high hovering near 62 degrees, it’s a refreshing kind of warmth, punctuated by the brisk winds that dance through the city, providing a subtle but invigorating chill. The fog, seemingly lingering just offshore, plays coy around the Golden Gate, teasing the edges of the city but leaving the vistas largely unobstructed. 

As evening approaches, expect the tranquility of a mostly clear night, perfect for winding down after a holiday of casual revelry. Dressing in layers would be wise—perhaps a light jacket to ward off the evening coolness will make your stroll along the waterfront even more pleasant. Consider a leisurely walk through one of the local parks, maybe catch the fading light over the Bay or enjoy an al fresco dinner at a nearby café, where the gentle hum of conversation melds with the cool breezes. The evening holds many promises; each moment invites you to immerse yourself in the charm of this coastal city as it unwinds into the twilight.
